page.title: 10Amenities
page.content: The village is about 2 miles from next village of Benson where there are more shops. Some people cycle to Benson, a few walk but most drive tehre in a car. There is a bus service which makes four journies to Wallingford each day except Sunday. On Sunday there are no buses out of the village. A mobile library visits the village fortnightly to supply books to those who cannot reach libraries in Benson and Wallingford. A mobile fish shop also visits the village on Fridays. To visit a doctor it is necesary to go to Benson, Watlington or Wallingford. A volunteer force of drivers takes people by car to visit the doctor at Benson if necessary
